meanings.definition: To surpass in number of rebounds.
meanings.sent1: During the game, our team always outrebounds the opponents.
meanings.sent2: The player outrebounds his teammates by grabbing more rebounds.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outrebounds the birds in collecting nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outrebounds all obstacles in her path is truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The river outrebounds its banks during the heavy rain, flooding the nearby fields.

meanings.definition: To gain possession of the ball after a missed shot.
meanings.sent1: He always outrebounds the other players to get the ball after a missed shot.
meanings.sent2: The key to winning the game is to outrebounds the opponents consistently.
meanings.sent3: The cat tries to outrebounds the dog in catching the ball first.
meanings.sent4: She managed to outrebounds her competitors and secure the victory.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete's speed allows him to outrebounds his opponents effortlessly.
